sap.description: Unique identifier for a work order in SAP.
sap.notes: Map to IDInInfoSource in MIMOSA; this is the unique identifier if SAP is the system of record.

mimosa.description: Unique identifier for WorkOrder from the originating InfoSource (SAP).
mimosa.notes: Primary key for exchanged work orders.

sap.description: Order category (e.g., PM01 for corrective maintenance).
sap.notes: Should be mapped to a reference data entry in MIMOSA WorkManagementType.ShortName, matching the type code or mapped category.

mimosa.description: Standardized work order type (e.g., Corrective Maintenance).
mimosa.notes: Map SAP order types to established MIMOSA WorkManagementType reference data.

sap.description: SAP User ID of the person who created the order.
sap.notes: Map to Agent entity where Agent.IDInInfoSource matches this SAP user ID. Map into /Creator/IDInInfoSource and /Creator/FullName if possible.

mimosa.description: The person who created the WorkOrder.
mimosa.notes: Assign creator agent to work order using both ID and, if available, full name.

sap.description: Date and time the order was created.
sap.notes: Map both date and time.

mimosa.description: Timestamp when the work order was created.

sap.description: SAP User ID of the person who last changed the order.
sap.notes: Map to Agent entity as per 'Entered by', but as last editor.

mimosa.description: The person who last edited the WorkOrder.
mimosa.notes: Assign last editor agent fields; FullName if available.

sap.fieldName: Change date for Order Number, Changed at
sap.description: Date/time of last change to order.

mimosa.description: Date/time the WorkOrder was last changed.

sap.fieldName: PM Order: Reference Date, Time of Reference Date
sap.description: Reference start date/time for work execution.
sap.notes: Often 'Basic start' in SAP BAPI structure, to WorkOrder.StartBefore in MIMOSA.

mimosa.description: Start work before this date/time.

sap.description: Planned basic finish date for an order (Production).
sap.notes: SAP BAPI has 'Basic end', should be mapped to WorkOrder.EndBefore in MIMOSA.

mimosa.description: Finish work before this date/time.

sap.description: Short text description for the order.
sap.notes: Should map to WorkOrder.FullName for a descriptive name.

mimosa.description: Short, descriptive name of the work order.
mimosa.notes: For user-friendly work order title.

sap.description: Multi-line long description for the work order.

mimosa.description: Detailed description of the work order.

sap.description: Priority for work order (1-4 in SAP standard).
sap.notes: Should map to PriorityLevelType (reference item) in MIMOSA. Map SAP values to correct reference values.

mimosa.description: Standardized value for work order priority.
mimosa.notes: Use mapped reference data for priorities.

sap.description: Identifier for the equipment being maintained.
sap.notes: Maps to Asset. Use Asset.IDInInfoSource to match Equipment Number, plus Asset.ShortName.

mimosa.description: Asset associated with the work order.
mimosa.notes: Link to Asset entity instance using Equipment Number.

sap.description: Unique ID for SAP Work Centre.
sap.notes: Can be mapped to MIMOSA Segment or Organization, or to a CustomProperty of WorkOrder/WorkStep as 'WorkCenter'. Not always required to exchange. Consider model extension/custom property.

mimosa.description: Identifies the work center responsible.
mimosa.notes: Recommended: use CustomProperty if no standard equivalent.

sap.description: Plant associated with the Work Center.
sap.notes: Should map to Site, Segment or Organization structure in MIMOSA. Often corresponds to /Segment/RegistrationSite/ShortName.

mimosa.description: Plant/site where the work center is located.

sap.description: Plant ID where maintenance is performed.
sap.notes: Map to MIMOSA Site entity where Site.ShortName equals Maintenance Plant.

mimosa.description: Short name/code for the site.

sap.description: Specific location within the plant for maintenance object.
sap.notes: May map to Segment entity for sub-location or physical unit, i.e., Segment.ShortName.

mimosa.description: Short name of segment/location.

sap.description: Text label for the functional location.
sap.notes: Represents the label for a Functional Location (Segment). Always reference Segment.FullName in MIMOSA.

mimosa.description: The full, descriptive name of the segment (functional location).

sap.fieldName: System Individual status of an object (short form) - Table TJ02T?
sap.notes: Should be mapped to WorkStatusType.ShortName in MIMOSA. Status changes create new WorkStatus records referencing correct WorkStatusType.

mimosa.description: Short name for work status.

sap.fieldName: User Individual status of an object (short form) - Table TJ30T?
sap.notes: Maps to WorkStatusType.FullName in MIMOSA (the long status description).

mimosa.description: Full name of work status.

sap.fieldName: Planner Group for Customer Service and Plant Maintenance
sap.notes: Reference an Agent entity for the planner group; add AgentRoleType for 'Planner Group'.

mimosa.description: Agent representing the planner group.
mimosa.notes: Link agent role for planner group as appropriate, with AgentRoleType.

sap.notes: Map to Agent.FullName.

mimosa.description: Full human-readable name of the planner group (Agent).

sap.notes: Map to more specialized WorkManagementType.ShortName, especially for WorkSteps.

mimosa.description: Name/Type of maintenance activity in standard taxonomy.
mimosa.notes: Typically used for steps, link via WorkStep.WorkManagementType.

sap.notes: Map to WorkManagementType.FullName for WorkSteps.

mimosa.description: Fully qualified name for maintenance activity type.

sap.notes: Map to HealthAssessment.HealthLevelPrecise referencing HealthLevelType.

mimosa.description: Assessment of health/condition of the asset.
mimosa.notes: Should reference mapped HealthLevelType.

sap.notes: Not mapped directly, but see HealthAssessment.HealthLevelType (reference value).

mimosa.description: Categorical level of health/condition.

sap.fieldName: Revision for Plant Maintenance and Customer Service
sap.description: Revision grouping work order for common execution window.
sap.notes: Map to parent work order in WorkOrderHierarchy or PresentLifeCycleStatus.ShortName.

mimosa.description: Short name for the revision grouping or status.
mimosa.notes: May indicate a grouped status or parent order.

sap.notes: Map to PresentLifeCycleStatus.FullName.

mimosa.description: Full description of life cycle status or revision.

sap.notes: Should map to Segment.Criticality and/or reference CriticalityScaleType if available.

mimosa.description: Criticality indicator for the segment.
mimosa.notes: ScaleType reference, e.g., 'A','B','C' with explanations.

sap.fieldName: Text for ABC Indicator for Technical Objects
sap.notes: Maps to explanation for Segment.Criticality or as a property.

mimosa.description: Explanatory text for the criticality rating.

sap.description: Business partner involved in the maintenance order.
sap.notes: Map to Agent/AgentRoleWithWork for partner roles on work order; Agent.ShortName.

mimosa.description: Short identifier for the partner agent.

sap.description: Full name of the person (from address data).
sap.notes: Use to populate Agent.FullName in MIMOSA.

mimosa.description: Agent's complete human-readable name.

sap.notes: Map to RequestForWork entity in MIMOSA where applicable.

mimosa.description: Unique notification/request id.
mimosa.notes: Link notifications to originating requests for work.

sap.description: Unique identifier for the operation/activity (work step).
sap.notes: Operations in Maintenance Orders are WorkSteps in MIMOSA; map as WorkStep.IDInInfoSource.

mimosa.description: Unique identifier for the step within a work order.

sap.description: Indicates type of operation (manual, external, scheduling params, etc.).
sap.notes: May map to WorkTaskType.ShortName reference or WorkStep.WorkManagementType.

mimosa.description: Type for broad operation category.
mimosa.notes: Add reference mapping as needed.

sap.fieldName: Standard text key (See Table 435 for Values)
sap.notes: If required, could map as a custom property or reference document.

mimosa.description: Reference to standardized task documentation.

sap.notes: Map to WorkStep.ShortName.

mimosa.description: Short descriptive name for a work step.

sap.fieldName: Values/Activity Number; Normal duration of activity
sap.notes: Maps to WorkStep.PlannedDuration.

mimosa.description: Planned duration for the step.

sap.description: Unit of time for duration (e.g., h = hours).
sap.notes: Map to WorkStep.PlannedDurationUnit or WorkStep.Measure.UnitOfMeasure.

mimosa.description: Unit for planned duration.

sap.fieldName: Values/Activity Number; Constraint on the basic start date for the activity
sap.description: Earliest possible start date/time for the operation.
sap.notes: Map to WorkStep.StartBefore.

mimosa.description: Operation must start before this time.

sap.fieldName: Values/Activity Number; Constraint on the finish date of activity
sap.description: Latest allowed finish for the operation.
sap.notes: Map to WorkStep.EndBefore.

mimosa.description: Operation must complete before this time.

sap.fieldName: Values/Activity Number; Earliest scheduled start (date and time)
sap.description: Earliest scheduled start time per SAP scheduling.
sap.notes: Map to WorkStep.StartAfter.

mimosa.description: Operation cannot start before this time.

sap.fieldName: Values/Activity Number; Earliest scheduled finish (date and time)
sap.description: Earliest scheduled finish time per SAP scheduling.
sap.notes: Map to WorkStep.EndAfter.

mimosa.description: Operation cannot finish before this time.

sap.fieldName: Fields/Activity Number; Key word ID for user-defined fields
sap.notes: Map to WorkStep.CustomProperty (Name/Value).

mimosa.description: User-defined property for the step.

sap.fieldName: Fields/Activity Number; User field with 20 characters
sap.description: User-defined field value for the operation.
sap.notes: Map to WorkStep.CustomProperty (Name/Value).

mimosa.description: User-defined property value for the step.

prompts: ["generate one field","imrove mapping pair","imrove mapping pair again"]

sap.description: Unique Equipment Number  system-generated or manually assigned identifier for each equipment record in SAP Plant Maintenance (PM). Serves as the primary key for equipment tracking and lifecycle management.
sap.notes: Primary key in SAP PM for equipment master record. Uniquely identifies each physical or logical asset in SAP; critical for asset tracking, maintenance history, and integration with external systems.

mimosa.description: Globally unique identifier for an asset in MIMOSA data models. Typically used to reference the asset across systems, including external sources like SAP EQUNR. Uniquely distinguishes each asset within MIMOSA and in interoperability scenarios.
mimosa.notes: Should store the value from SAP's EQUNR for cross-system mapping. May include other external identifiers if required, but in context of SAP integration, maps 1:1 with SAP Equipment Number. String length should accommodate all possible identifier formats from integrated systems.

sap.description: Unique Equipment Number  primary key in SAP for identifying each physical piece of equipment.
sap.notes: Serves as the main unique identifier for equipment master records in SAP PM. Fixed length, typically zero-padded on the left.

mimosa.description: Globally unique identifier for a physical asset in MIMOSA. May support multiple identification formats including serial numbers, tags, or plant-specific codes.
mimosa.notes: Primary key or main identifier corresponding to SAP's EQUNR. MIMOSA allows for various identifier schemes; ensure consistency across systems for integration.

sap.description: Unique identifier (Equipment Number) for each item of equipment in the SAP system. Typically used to track and manage assets throughout their lifecycle.
sap.notes: Primary key for equipment records in SAP; value is unique within the SAP client and usually numeric or alphanumeric.

mimosa.description: Globally unique identifier for a physical asset in the MIMOSA data model, enabling cross-system asset tracking and integration.
mimosa.notes: Primary unique key for assets in MIMOSA; should be mapped to a globally unique or namespace-prepended value to avoid conflicts when integrating multiple systems.

sap.description: Equipment Number: Unique identifier for a specific physical equipment item within SAP Plant Maintenance (PM) module.
sap.notes: Serves as the primary key for the equipment master record (EQUI). Maximum length is 18 alphanumeric characters. Used for asset lifecycle tracking and integration.

mimosa.description: Asset Identifier: Globally unique identifier for an asset in the MIMOSA OSA-EAI information model.
mimosa.notes: Serves as the primary key for the Asset entity. Must be unique within the enterprise or system context. Used for cross-system asset tracking and interoperability; directly corresponds to EQUNR from SAP.

sap.description: Unique identifier for a specific equipment record in SAP Plant Maintenance (PM). Typically an alphanumeric key assigned when an equipment master is created. Serves as the primary reference for tracking maintenance, history, and asset data.
sap.notes: Acts as the primary key in the SAP Equipment (EQUI) master database. This identifier must be unique within the SAP instance and is used extensively for linking technical objects, maintenance notifications, work orders, and asset structures.

mimosa.description: Globally unique string identifier for an individual asset within the MIMOSA Asset entity. Used to track and reference assets across multiple external systems, including SAP. Serves as the canonical key for an asset in MIMOSA data structures.
mimosa.notes: Primary key for the Asset entity in MIMOSA. When integrating with SAP, populate AssetIdentifier with the value from SAP's Equipment (EQUIPMENT) field. If the target system requires increased identifier length or enforces uniqueness constraints across multiple SAP sources, consider prefixing or extending EQUIPMENT to ensure global uniqueness within the MIMOSA context.

sap.description: Unique number identifying the equipment in SAP.
sap.notes: Usually referred to as EQUNR in tables like EQUI.

mimosa.description: Uniquely identifies an equipment item in MIMOSA schema.
mimosa.notes: Primary field for equipment entities.

sap.description: Manufacturer serial number of the equipment.
sap.notes: Field SERNR in EQUI table.

mimosa.description: Serial number associated with the equipment.
mimosa.notes: MIMOSA equivalent of equipment serial number.

sap.notes: Field EQKTX in EQUI table.

mimosa.description: Textual description of the equipment item.
mimosa.notes: Typically description or title in MIMOSA equipment.

sap.notes: Herst in EQUI table.

mimosa.description: Organization or company that manufactured the equipment.
mimosa.notes: String type, more extensive field in MIMOSA.

sap.description: Manufacturer's model number for the equipment.
sap.notes: Field TYPBZ in EQUI table.

mimosa.description: Model number for the equipment in MIMOSA schema.
mimosa.notes: Direct match for model number field.

sap.description: Functional location where the equipment is installed.
sap.notes: TPLNR in EQUI table.

mimosa.description: Unique identifier referencing the functional location of installation.
mimosa.notes: Functional location reference in MIMOSA asset structure.

sap.description: Date when equipment was first put into operation.
sap.notes: Inbdt in EQUI table.

mimosa.description: Date when the equipment became operational.
mimosa.notes: Standard date type in MIMOSA.

prompt: it does not contain all fields
prompts: it does not contain all fields

sap.notes: Unique identifier for the work order in SAP (primary key for work order tables, stored as a 12-character string with possible leading zeros). Avoid removing leading zeros for referential integrity.

mimosa.description: Unique identifier for the work order, matching SAP's AUFNR. Used as primary key/reference throughout MIMOSA.
mimosa.notes: Preserve leading zeros from SAP AUFNR. Ensure the value transferred as a string and maintain referential uniqueness across both systems. Field is case-sensitive.

sap.notes: Short, user-defined description for the work order (maximum 40 characters in SAP); special characters may be present.

mimosa.description: Short description or title for the work order, sourced from SAP KTEXT. Primarily used for quick identification and listing.
mimosa.notes: Populate with SAP KTEXT. If a longer description is available in SAP (e.g., long text), consider mapping to a separate MIMOSA field. Truncate or pad if necessary to fit SAP's 40-character limit for this field.

sap.notes: Categorization of work order (e.g., PM01 = Maintenance, PM02 = Corrective). Codes are client-configurable and stored as 4 characters.

mimosa.description: Type/category code of the work order, mapped directly from SAP AUART. Used to manage processing logic or reporting.
mimosa.notes: Store AUART code as-is. Optional: Maintain a lookup table in MIMOSA for expanding code into description. Validate codes against SAP config to avoid orphan values.

sap.notes: SAP user ID or personnel number (case-sensitive) of the creator. If personnel number is used, cross-reference to user table may be needed.

mimosa.description: Identifier for the user or originator that created the work order, typically the SAP user ID or personnel number.
mimosa.notes: Map directly from SAP ERNAM. If a personnel number is used in SAP, provide a cross-reference to a human identifier in MIMOSA User/Person entity for linkage and clarity.

sap.notes: Planned start date of the work order. Stored in YYYYMMDD format without a time component. May not correspond to actual execution start.

mimosa.description: Planned or scheduled start date for the work order, mapped from SAP GSTRP.
mimosa.notes: Convert SAP format YYYYMMDD to ISO8601 format YYYY-MM-DD. No time value present unless mapped from another SAP field.

sap.notes: Planned or scheduled end date of the work order. Stored in YYYYMMDD format. Time not included; actual finish may differ based on process.

mimosa.description: Planned or scheduled finish/end date of the work order, derived from SAP GLTRP.
mimosa.notes: Map and convert to ISO8601 date format (YYYY-MM-DD). No time; must be mapped from a different SAP field if needed.

sap.notes: Identifier for technical object (equipment/functional location) linked to the work order. Prefix indicates type (e.g., EQ for Equipment, FL for Functional Location). To relate to actual asset, parse suffix or cross-reference with asset/equipment master table.

mimosa.description: Identifier for the asset, equipment, or location associated with the work order. Should correspond to an Asset or Location record in MIMOSA.
mimosa.notes: Populate from SAP OBJNR. For integration, parse or crosswalk OBJNR to resolve to the actual assets unique ID. Prefix (EQ, FL, etc.) may need processing for precise linkage to Asset/Location entities in MIMOSA.

sap.notes: Primary key for equipment master

mimosa.description: Globally unique identifier for asset
mimosa.notes: Primary identifier in MIMOSA data model

prompt: generate two mapping field of asset
prompts: generate two mapping field of asset

sap.description: Main Asset Number (unique identification of asset)
sap.notes: Primary key for asset in SAP Asset Accounting (FI-AA)

mimosa.description: Unique identifier for the asset
mimosa.notes: Serves as the primary identifier in MIMOSA data model

sap.description: Asset Class (categorizes the asset according to financial/statutory requirements)
sap.notes: Defines how the asset is managed and reported in SAP

mimosa.description: Type or class of the asset
mimosa.notes: Used to classify assets in the MIMOSA model

prompts: generate one mapping field of asset

sap.description: Equipment Number - unique identifier assigned by SAP to each individual physical asset in the system.
sap.notes: Primary key for the equipment (asset) master record in the SAP Plant Maintenance (PM) module. Used for maintenance, tracking, and integration purposes.

mimosa.description: Globally unique identifier for an asset in the MIMOSA Common Data Model. Can contain source system identifiers for asset interoperability.
mimosa.notes: Intended to store a unique asset reference that may include the SAP EQUNR value. When integrating, the SAP equipment number (EQUNR) should populate AssetIdentifier, potentially with additional system context for global uniqueness.

promptHistory.text: generate one mapping field of asset
improve mapping pair

prompts: generate one mapping field of asset

sap.description: Unique identifier assigned internally by SAP to each fixed asset. Used to track asset records throughout their lifecycle in SAP systems.
sap.notes: Primary key field 'ANLN1' in the ANLA (Asset Master Record Segment) table for asset master data in SAP ERP. Typically combined with company code ('BUKRS') for global uniqueness.

mimosa.description: Universally unique identifier (UUID/GUID) for the asset, as per MIMOSA specifications. Used to uniquely reference an asset across systems and organizational boundaries.
mimosa.notes: Primary key for the Asset entity in the MIMOSA data model. Typically a 36-character UUID (with hyphens). Mapping from SAP ASSET_NO may require additional context (e.g., company code) or translation to conform to MIMOSA's uniqueness requirements.

promptHistory.text: generate one mapping field of asset
improve mapping pair
generate 4 mapping field of asset
improve mappings

sap.description: Equipment Number  unique identifier for an equipment master record.
sap.notes: Primary key for SAP equipment asset; static identifier used throughout lifecycle.

mimosa.description: Globally unique identifier for the asset, persistent across all systems.
mimosa.notes: Primary key for asset instance in MIMOSA; can map directly from SAP EQUNR if no duplication.

sap.description: Short Text  brief and concise description of the equipment.
sap.notes: Limited to 40 characters; used as a label or summary in SAP equipment tables.

mimosa.description: Concise textual summary describing the asset (short name or label).
mimosa.notes: May map directly from SAP EQKTU, padding or truncating as needed. Maximum length in MIMOSA is 128 characters.

sap.description: Equipment Category  1-character code signifying the generalized type or category of the equipment (e.g. 'M' for machines, 'V' for vehicles).
sap.notes: Coded value defined in SAP customizing. Typically must be mapped to corresponding controlled vocabulary or enumerated value in target system.

mimosa.description: Classification or category of the asset (should reference a standardized asset class, e.g. taxonomy or code list).
mimosa.notes: Map SAP's EQTYP code to a MIMOSA-recognized AssetClass value. May require cross-reference table/logic. Up to 32 characters.

sap.description: Serial Number  unique manufacturer-assigned identifier for the physical equipment item.
sap.notes: If available, allows distinction of unique physical instances; not always required or present for all equipment records.

mimosa.description: Manufacturer-assigned unique serial number for the specific asset instance.
mimosa.notes: Direct mapping; serial numbers may be padded/truncated. Required for physical traceability in MIMOSA.

promptHistory.text: generate 4 mapping field of asset
improve mapping pairs
improve mapping pairs

sap.description: System-assigned unique identifier for each equipment or asset record in SAP Plant Maintenance (PM).
sap.notes: Technical field name: EQUNR; the primary key in SAP equipment master (EQUI) table. Leading zeros are typically used; always store and transmit all digits including leading zeros for data integrity and to ensure referential accuracy.

mimosa.description: Globally unique identifier for an asset within MIMOSA systems. May originate from internal generation or be mapped from authoritative external systems such as SAP.
mimosa.notes: Map SAP EQUNR directly into AssetID, preserving leading zeros and source formatting. Ensure global uniqueness for each AssetID, including source context if possible (e.g., prefix/EQUNR or composite keys if integrating multiple source systems).

sap.description: User-supplied short text providing a concise description or name for the equipment or asset. Used for human recognition and display.
sap.notes: Technical field: EQKTX in SAP EQUI table. Not guaranteed to be unique; used for user interface display and quick identification. Consider character set compatibility (UTF-8).

mimosa.description: Primary descriptive text for the asset, typically used as a display name or label in user interfaces.
mimosa.notes: Populate from SAP Equipment Description (EQKTX). If necessary, enhance with further details for uniqueness, ensuring the field is not truncated when mapping to MIMOSAs larger length (255). Handle encoding and special characters.

sap.description: Manufacturer-assigned serial number associated with the physical asset, used for asset lifecycle tracking and traceability.
sap.notes: Technical field: SERNR. May be blank if the asset is not serialized. Always preserve formatting, including leading zeros or mixed case. Apply the mapping only for assets where SERNR is populated.

mimosa.description: Manufacturers serial number for the asset, supporting precise asset identification and traceability across systems.
mimosa.notes: Map directly from SAP SERNR where present. Support alphanumeric, special characters, and leading zeros. Leave blank in MIMOSA if SERNR is missing in SAP. Validate length and format where possible.

sap.description: Name of the organization or entity that produced, supplied, or branded the asset or equipment, as recorded in SAP.
sap.notes: Technical field: HERST. Free-text entry; may vary in case, spelling, or abbreviation. Consider harmonizing/correcting entries for master data consistency across integrated systems.

mimosa.description: Full, normalized name of the assets manufacturer or supplier. Used for reporting, analytics, and part master linkage.
mimosa.notes: Populate from SAP HERST; normalize for case (e.g., 'SIEMENS' vs 'Siemens'), spelling, and abbreviations (e.g., 'GE' vs 'General Electric'). Remove extraneous characters. Consider referencing a controlled vocabulary or manufacturer master for standardization in MIMOSA.

sap.notes: Primary Key in SAP asset table

sap.description: Order Number, uniquely identifies a work order in SAP.

mimosa.description: A concise identifier for the WorkOrder, typically used as a reference or display number.

sap.description: Order Type, categorizes the nature of the maintenance or service order.

mimosa.description: Classification of the management type for the work order, representing categories such as preventive maintenance, corrective maintenance, inspection, etc.

sap.description: Username of the person who created the order.

mimosa.description: The person or agent responsible for creating this WorkOrder entry.

sap.description: Date on which the work order was created.

mimosa.description: The specific date when the WorkOrder was initially created in the system.

sap.description: Username of the last person to change the order.

mimosa.description: The last user or agent that modified or edited the WorkOrder details.

sap.description: Time at which the last change was made to the order. (Format: HHMMSS)

mimosa.description: Exact time when the WorkOrder was most recently modified, typically represented as hours, minutes, and seconds.

sap.description: Reference date for the maintenance order, indicating the planned start or reference point.

mimosa.description: The earliest date or deadline by which the work order should begin to meet scheduling requirements.

sap.description: Planned finish or end date for the work order's basic schedule.

mimosa.description: The requested date by which the work order should be completed to fulfill operational or contractual requirements.

sap.description: Descriptive text providing details about the work order such as work to be performed.

mimosa.description: A full, descriptive name or title of the WorkOrder, usually including essential details for clear identification.

sap.description: Priority set for the maintenance order, typically used to influence planning, scheduling, and execution.

mimosa.description: Classification of the WorkOrder's priority, such as 'High', 'Medium', or 'Low'. Used for resource allocation and scheduling.

sap.description: Unique Equipment Number this work order is related to, referencing the item being maintained.

mimosa.description: The identifier of the equipment associated with the WorkOrder, linking maintenance tasks directly to the asset.
mimosa.notes: Previously mapped to ShortName. Corrected for accuracy.

sap.description: Maintenance Plant where the equipment is installed or serviced.

mimosa.description: Location or facility (site) where the WorkOrder and corresponding assets are officially registered or maintained.

sap.description: Physical location or coordinates of the maintenance object within the plant or site.

mimosa.description: Physical or logical location where maintenance is to be performed, providing spatial context for the WorkOrder.
mimosa.notes: Previously mapped to ShortName. Corrected for clarity and precision.

sap.description: Version number of the functional location label, distinguishing between revisions or changes.

mimosa.description: Version identifier of the functional location pertinent to the WorkOrder, enabling traceability across versions.
mimosa.notes: Previously mapped to FullName. Clarified mapping to reflect real-world usage.

sap.description: Planner Group responsible for the maintenance order, indicating organizational responsibility.

mimosa.description: Unique identifier or code for the group planning and overseeing the work order's execution.
mimosa.notes: Previously mapped to ShortName. Updated to a more accurate and descriptive field.

sap.description: Name of the Maintenance Planner Group responsible for creating and managing maintenance orders.

mimosa.description: Full name or description of the planner group linked to the WorkOrder, used for reporting or accountability.
mimosa.notes: Previously mapped to FullName. Clarified for semantic consistency.

sap.description: Maintenance Activity Type, further classifies nature of work (e.g., inspection, repair).

mimosa.description: Coded type or classification for the maintenance activity performed as part of the WorkOrder.
mimosa.notes: Previously mapped to ShortName. Updated for clarity and precision.

sap.description: Text description of the maintenance activity type, providing user-readable details.

mimosa.description: User-friendly name or description for the maintenance activity performed under the WorkOrder.
mimosa.notes: Previously mapped to FullName. Name clarified for context.

sap.description: System condition at the time of maintenance (e.g., running, stopped).

mimosa.description: Numeric or coded representation of the asset's precise health or operating state at work order creation.

sap.description: Text describing the operating or asset health condition in detail.

mimosa.description: Descriptive assessment of the asset's health, typically using defined terms (e.g., Excellent, Poor).

sap.description: Revision number for the maintenance order, used to track changes or versions.

mimosa.description: Unique identifier representing the revision or version of the WorkOrder for change history tracking.
mimosa.notes: Previously mapped to ShortName. Field name clarified.

sap.description: Description or explanatory text for the order's revision.

mimosa.description: A meaningful text describing the nature or rationale of the WorkOrder's revision.
mimosa.notes: Previously mapped to FullName. Field name clarified.

sap.description: Partner number, linking a business partner (person or organization) to the work order.

mimosa.description: Identifier of the business partner associated with this WorkOrder, enabling responsibility tracking.
mimosa.notes: Previously mapped to ShortName. Field name and description improved.

sap.description: Full display name of the person, used for identification in partner and user tables.

mimosa.description: Full name of the individual associated with the WorkOrder (e.g., creator, assignee, or responsible person).
mimosa.notes: Previously mapped to FullName. Clarified to emphasize person context.

sap.description: Activity type assigned to the operation, indicating the kind of activity performed.

mimosa.description: Category or type of task performed as part of the WorkOrder (e.g., labor, analysis, inspection).

sap.description: Functional Location Number, uniquely identifies a location within asset hierarchy.
sap.notes: Typically hierarchical, e.g. PLANT-AREA-LOCATION.

mimosa.description: Unique identifier for a Segment within the MIMOSA Open Object Model.
mimosa.notes: Used for unique identification in asset structures.

sap.description: Functional Location Description, gives details about the location.
sap.notes: Used for human-readable naming.

mimosa.description: Text description of the Segment, often human-readable.
mimosa.notes: Gives the semantic meaning of the segment.

mimosa.description: Unique identifier for a work order
mimosa.notes: Primary key for work order in MIMOSA

sap.notes: Defines the type/category of the work order (e.g. PM01, PM02); cryptic SAP entity/table name: AUFK

mimosa.description: Type/category of the work order
mimosa.notes: Aligns to order classification

sap.notes: Short text describing the work order; cryptic SAP entity/table name: AUFK

mimosa.description: Brief description of the work order
mimosa.notes: Field for work order summary/short text

mimosa.description: Identifier of the person or system that created the work order
mimosa.notes: Creator of the work order

sap.notes: Date the work order was created in SAP; cryptic SAP entity/table name: AUFK

mimosa.notes: Work order creation date

sap.notes: Scheduled basic start date for the work order; cryptic SAP entity/table name: AUFK

mimosa.description: Scheduled start of the work order
mimosa.notes: Date field for planned start

sap.notes: Scheduled basic finish date for the work order; cryptic SAP entity/table name: AUFK

mimosa.notes: Date field for planned finish

sap.notes: Plant responsible for work order planning; cryptic SAP entity/table name: AUFK

sap.notes: Reference to technical object (equipment or functional location); cryptic SAP entity/table name: AUFK

sap.notes: Code representing the status profile assigned to the work order; cryptic SAP entity/table name: AUFK

prompts: Generate SAP mappings for the MIMOSA work order fields of WorkManagmentType
Improve mapping for SAP by using cryptic names

promptHistory.text: Generate SAP mappings for the MIMOSA work order fields of WorkManagmentType, priority level and created
Improve mapping for SAP by using cryptic names

sap.description: Order Type: Defines the category of work being managed in the work order.
sap.notes: AUFK-AUART (Order Type) in SAP PM module.

mimosa.description: Specifies the management category for a work order.
mimosa.notes: Represents high-level classification of work orders.

sap.description: Priority: Indicates the urgency level associated with the work order.
sap.notes: Typically stored as AUFK-PRIOK (Priority) or AFVC-PRIOK in SAP PM module.

mimosa.description: The overall priority classification for the work order.
mimosa.notes: Defines the order in which work should be performed.

sap.description: Created On: Date when the work order was created in the system.
sap.notes: AUFK-ERDAT (Creation Date) in SAP PM module.

mimosa.description: Date and time the work order record was created.
mimosa.notes: Represents timestamp of work order creation.

Improve mapping for SAP by using cryptic names for fields and tables

sap.description: Order Type: Specifies the category of work for the order (e.g., maintenance, inspection)
sap.notes: SAP Table: AUFK, Field: AUART

mimosa.description: Type or category of work management action for the work order
mimosa.notes: Common values: Inspection, Maintenance, Upgrade, Repair

sap.description: Priority: Defines the priority level for processing the order
sap.notes: SAP Table: AUFK, Field: PRIOT

mimosa.description: Indicates the priority level assigned to the work order
mimosa.notes: Should be mapped to internal priority codes or descriptions

sap.description: Created On: Date when the work order was created
sap.notes: SAP Table: AUFK, Field: ERDAT

mimosa.description: Timestamp or date when the work order was created
mimosa.notes: ISO 8601 date-time format recommended

mimosa.description: Unique short identifier for the Work Order, typically the order number.

sap.notes: Defines type of the Work Order (e.g., PM01, PM02)

mimosa.description: Type of work management process associated with the work order, such as corrective, preventive, etc.
mimosa.notes: Maps to Order Type in SAP

sap.notes: SAP username that created the order

mimosa.description: The agent or user who created the work order record.
mimosa.notes: Maps to Entered By (ERNAM) in SAP

sap.notes: Date record was created

mimosa.notes: Maps the order creation date

sap.notes: SAP username that last changed the order

sap.notes: Time of the last change

mimosa.notes: Maps to Changed at (AEZEIT) in SAP

sap.description: PM Order: Reference Date, Time of Reference Date
sap.notes: Earliest planned start date of the work order

mimosa.description: Requested latest start date for the work order.
mimosa.notes: Maps to Reference Date in SAP; for scheduling

sap.notes: Basic scheduled finish date for the order

mimosa.notes: Maps to basic finish date for work order completion

sap.notes: Textual description/title of the work order

mimosa.description: Full descriptive name or summary for the WorkOrder.
mimosa.notes: Maps to KTEXT in SAP

sap.notes: Priority code for the order

mimosa.description: Priority level or classification for the WorkOrder (e.g. High, Medium, Low).
mimosa.notes: Derived from PRIOK in SAP; possible mapping to enumeration

sap.notes: Links work order to specific equipment asset

mimosa.description: Reference to the associated asset or equipment for the work order.
mimosa.notes: Maps to EQUNR in SAP

sap.notes: Key for the plant/site responsible for the work order

sap.notes: Physical location for the maintenance object

mimosa.notes: Maps to maintenance object location

sap.notes: Label or version number for functional location

mimosa.notes: Maps to VERSN in SAP

sap.description: Planner Group for Customer Service and Plant Maintenance
sap.notes: Identifies the group responsible for planning

mimosa.notes: Maps to INGPR in SAP

sap.notes: Name or text for the planner group

mimosa.description: Descriptive name of the planner or planning group.
mimosa.notes: Maps to INNAM in SAP

sap.notes: Code for the type of activity performed

mimosa.notes: Maps to ILART in SAP

sap.notes: Descriptive text of maintenance activity type

mimosa.description: Full descriptive name for the maintenance activity type.
mimosa.notes: Maps to ILATX in SAP

sap.notes: System/asset condition at time of order creation

mimosa.notes: Maps system condition upon work order creation

sap.notes: Description of asset's health or status

mimosa.description: Classification or description for asset health (0-100 scale).

sap.description: Revision for Plant Maintenance and Customer Service
sap.notes: Revision or batch number for groupings of work

mimosa.notes: Maps to PARNR in SAP

sap.notes: Specifies the type of activity for operation/task
